akas: Großes Glück im kleinen Haus Germany
akas from release info: Großes Glück im kleinen Haus Germany

1.title: Traveling Tiny Firehouse
1.plot: A couple creates the ultimate tiny firehouse-on-wheels complete with a red garage door, functional fire hydrant, fire pole and more.

2.title: Luxury Tiny Home on the Lake
2.plot: A Los Angeles woman wants a slow-paced tiny lifestyle in Greenville, SC. Her tiny house designer calls on her family to create custom artwork and features including a deck and greenhouse that make this tiny house special.

3.title: Tiny California Luxury
3.plot: The high cost of homes in the San Francisco Bay Area leads a young couple to build a custom tiny house. Their luxury home has more bells and whistles than a full-size mansion, including a roll-up garage door and dining set for 12.

4.title: Midcentury Tiny
4.plot: A couple relocates from North Carolina to Florida and decides to build a midcentury-style tiny home. Their must-haves include an eclectic front door, funky wallpaper, neon signs and a guest space with a floating daybed.

5.title: Tiny Cargo Van Conversion
5.plot: Travel enthusiasts are ready to convert a cargo van into a tiny house. Their space-saving design includes a queen-sized bed with storage underneath and a loft for their toddler that features a cozy bed and safety rails.

6.title: Chef's Tiny House
6.plot: A couple of foodies simplify their lifestyle by moving into their own tiny house complete with a chef's kitchen, a full bar and an herb garden.

7.title: Tiny Honeymoon House
7.plot: An engaged couple plans to realize their dream of going tiny by building a tiny home before their wedding. Their 275 square-foot design includes a yoga practice space, a second story deck, a wooden bathtub and rustic accents.

8.title: Tiny Treehouse
8.plot: A California couple builds the ultimate treehouse escape perched high in a circle of redwoods. The tiny home packs plenty of engineering ingenuity and handcrafted features, including a water pumping system and a hidden bookcase.

9.title: New York Tiny Tech Compound
9.plot: After living in NYC for 20 years, a couple is moving upstate with their son and French bulldog into a 400-square-foot tiny home. This build has 3 separate structures joined by a common deck to create a more spacious tiny compound.

10.title: California Container
10.plot: A young CA couple hires Missouri builders to help build their dream container home. This luxury "tiny" will feature a master bedroom loft, a guest bed that lifts and doubles as an office, a walk-in closet and a rooftop deck.

11.title: Chic Florida Tiny
11.plot: A Florida couple throws the budget out the window as they build a customized high-end tiny complete with a full-size kitchen, heated bathroom floors and a glass rain shower.

12.title: Vibrant Modern Tiny
12.plot: A young couple builds a bright and modern tiny home perfect for their lifestyle. Their tiny house incorporates a stucco-like exterior, a rooftop deck and a second-story "hammock floor" that gives guests a place to stay.

13.title: Tiny Alaskan Homestead
13.plot: A California couple wants a simpler life in the great outdoors of Alaska. He plans to use his aerospace engineering experience to complete most of the build, but her creativity is what will set their 400-square-foot cabin apart.

1.title: Jenna and Guillaume's Adventure House-on-Wheels
1.plot: Jenna & Guillaume plan to make America their own backyard with an adventure house-on-wheels.

2.title: Derek and Mary's Little House on the Prairie
2.plot: Derek and Mary Voight hire builder Greg Parham to construct their luxury tiny house on wheels.

3.title: Tiny House with Special Creature Comforts
3.plot: Trevor and Mary are building a tiny house for themselves and their four cats.

4.title: Kaitlin's Tiny Farmhouse
4.plot: Trevor and Mary are building a tiny house for themselves and their four cats.

5.title: Chloe and Brandon's Modern-Day Gypsy Wagon
5.plot: A young couple of designers builds a tiny house influenced by pirate ships and caravans.

6.title: Jewel Pearson's Tiny House Gem
6.plot: Jewel builds an extravagant tiny house with luxuries like a balcony, porch, floating stairs and a walk-in closet.

7.title: Kris and Betty's Colorado Cottage-on-Wheels
7.plot: Artist Kris and hair stylist Betty design a tiny home to fit their career goals.

8.title: Mark & Angela's Tiny Road House
8.plot: Mark and Angela Eaves want a tiny house that moves with them as they relocate around Texas for work.

9.title: Charles and Dakota's Tiny Bus House
9.plot: Charles and Dakota create a tiny house out of a bus with a fold-out desk and yoga studio.

10.title: Jenn Baxter's Decked Out Tiny House
10.plot: Writer Jenn's tiny house boasts a rooftop deck, hidden washer and dryer and lots of cubbyholes.

11.title: Austin and Kaytyln's Kansas City Tiny House
11.plot: Newlyweds Austin and Kaytlyn Averill are making it official and trading in their 1200-square-foot home for a tiny house love nest!

12.title: Jarrod and Ali's Tiny Winery Homes
12.plot: Washington family winery owners, Jarrod and Ali wish to re-visit their tiny, carefree past and challenge two teams of builders to create the most amazing tiny guest abode ever!

13.title: Alex and Lance's Amazing Unfoldable Tiny House
13.plot: Building designers Alex and Lance create an expandable tiny vacation house-on-wheels.

14.title: Rob's Eco-Living Tiny House
14.plot: Rob Irwin knows a lot about form and function working together. This industrial designer is building a 300-square feet house with all sorts of engineering feats and eco-friendly features.

1.title: Hawaiian Tiny House
1.plot: Nathan and Jenny build their own 314-square-foot yurt on Hawaii's North Shore. Their tiny home is complete with a separate bathroom yurt and an aquaponics pond for growing produce.

2.title: Tiny Surf House
2.plot: Mark and Jen want a tiny house in Naples, Florida, where they can paddleboard to the gulf and soak in the sun

3.title: Tricked-Out Tiny House
3.plot: Caitlin and Zach Hogan want a tiny house that perfectly fits the needs of their family of four. The only catch? The cozy home must be finished before the family moves to Nevada for a new career opportunity.

4.title: Chrissy's Tiny Green Home
4.plot: Chrissy wants to incorporate as many reclaimed or reused materials as she can in her tiny house build in Burlington, VT, but her builder Seth isn't too keen on the idea. Will Chrissy have to give up on some of her "green" dreams?

5.title: Texas Tiny House
5.plot: Texans Cody and Alexia St. John are designing a tiny house around its resale value. The beautiful 28-foot home boasts an adjustable loft floor, a custom armoire and a full-size kitchen. Will their family agree it's the right move?

6.title: Joe & April's Tiny Dream Home
6.plot: After a near-death experience, Joe and April have decided it's time to change and get a tiny house. Builders Bruce and Bart create a sleek home with a gourmet kitchen and plenty of space for their daughter Sophie.

7.title: Tiny House for Three
7.plot: Expectant parents Tom and Hannah are eager to move from their travel trailer to a roomier 300-square-foot tiny house. Hannah wants to have a home birth in their new place, so the house must be finished in just a few weeks.

8.title: Tiny House Work-in-Progress
8.plot: Unanticipated relocation forces Sam and Ellee to move to California in their half-finished tiny house. Can they stay motivated in order to finish the build, or will the stress get to them?

9.title: Tiny Thrifty Ski Cabin
9.plot: Bridget and Billy are leaving their expensive Denver rental to build a tiny house on a tight budget and take it on the ultimate road trip back to Portland. Will they have what it takes to get this house ready for the road trip?

10.title: Tiny Fitness Nest
10.plot: Personal trainers Mike and Jasmine want a house that's tailored to their fitness lifestyle. They get a 330-square-foot fitness nest with a climbing wall and weight storage.

11.title: Traveling Actor's Tiny House
11.plot: An actor inspired by Thoreau's Walden wants a mobile tiny house that's off the grid and eco-friendly.

12.title: Tiny School Bus Abode
12.plot: A couple salvages an old school bus to create their very own 100-square-foot tiny house.

13.title: Tiny Birch House
13.plot: Nature lovers Justin and Emily want an outdoor-themed tiny birch house that will accommodate them, their toddler and their five pets. Key features include in-floor storage, a toddler play loft and raw birch accents throughout.

14.title: Tiny Snowbirds Nest
14.plot: David and Teresa love their lives in Michigan but hate the winter weather. With the help of their family and friends, the Crawford's are building a tiny house so they can be snowbirds.

1.title: Tiny Alaskan Cabin on Ice
1.plot: A husband-and-wife carpenter team races Mother Nature to finish their tiny cabin before the spring thaw in Alaska.

2.title: Tiny Art House
2.plot: Margaret is a young artist who wants to create the ultimate expression of herself in a tiny house. She gets help from her mother and grandmother, who assist Margaret in bringing her artistic vision to life.

3.title: Tiny Bayou Bus
3.plot: A Louisiana family works together to convert an old school bus into the ultimate man cave for their 21-year-old son. The tiny Bayou home features a fish cleaning table, a cypress wood bar and an indoor hammock.

4.title: Tiny Work Haven
4.plot: A young couple leaves their stressful life in New York to build a cozy 130-square-foot home that features an inviting workspace with a massive window, a loft hammock and a hanging garden.

5.title: Tiny Tilting Tower Home
5.plot: North Dakota builder Jim Nelson lives for a challenge, so he and his team are building a game-changing two-story tiny house that they can tilt from horizontal to vertical.

6.title: Tiny House for Four
6.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

7.title: Tiny Techy Tricked-Out-House
7.plot: Design-obsessed couple Zane and Katherine are ready to try building tiny homes as a business. They plan to live in their computer-engineered tiny house to test it out before they build more.

8.title: Lilly's Tiny Circus Home
8.plot: Traveling circus performer Lilly builds a mobile tiny house so she never has to leave home. Features include a storage compartment for her circus equipment and a sunken bathtub to soak in after performances.

9.title: Nashville's "Tiny" Innovation
9.plot: David builds a one-of-a-kind tiny house in Nashville with a garage door, jacuzzi and fold-out deck.

10.title: Young Craftsman's Tiny House
10.plot: Three generations of craftsmen build a tiny house for the youngest of the family and upcycle old family items into new pieces.

11.title: Tiny House, Big Storage
11.plot: Jesse and Michelle are ready to become homeowners but are unsure where the future will take them. A tiny house-on-wheels is the perfect answer, as long as they have enough storage for their botany experiments, books and supplies.

12.title: Tiny Bus Workshop
12.plot: Artisan and world traveler Sarah converts a school bus into her dream home complete with a commercial sewing workshop, bubble skylights, a rooftop deck and more.

13.title: Expedition Tiny House
13.plot: A couple hires a builder to create a home for their extreme expeditions.

14.title: Tiny Island Living
14.plot: With the help of their Virgin Island community, a young couple builds their dream tiny home on family property in St. John. They incorporate a wrap-around porch and open living room walls to enjoy island scenery and ocean breezes.

1.title: The Simple Container Life
1.plot: Emily is moving into a shipping container turned tiny house to prove she can live a simpler lifestyle, and she's asking brother-in-law Jon to build a massive rooftop deck and a walk-in closet for her enormous shoe collection.

2.title: Greg and Carla's Musical Tiny House
2.plot: Greg and Carla are giving tiny living a try outside Morgantown, West Virginia. Greg is a musician and his band is helping him craft the house, which includes a detachable stage for performances and other music-themed features.

3.title: Tiny Sheepherder's Wagon
3.plot: Rebecca and Kendall push tiny to the extreme by giving up their traditional American home for an 84-square-foot tiny sheep wagon with no plumbing. They're not "sheepish" to admit that their friends are their biggest skeptics.

4.title: Grad School Tiny House
4.plot: Architecture student Davis takes over his parents' driveway to construct his first tiny house. The design includes a slanted wall that is both an open food pantry and bookshelf and an extended kitchen countertop.

5.title: Tiny Smart House
5.plot: Kansas State professor Brandon wants an affordable house with some fun bells and whistles, so he and a friend design a 365-square-foot smart house with some high-tech features, including a video doorbell and slide-away TV set.

6.title: Esin's Tiny 'elevated' Haven
6.plot: After moving back to Texas to be near her family, Esin builds a tiny house that boasts an elevator and all the amenities a dog lover could imagine.

7.title: Tiny Customized Craftsman
7.plot: An artist gets some family help while customizing his tiny Craftsman-style bungalow for a tiny house festival. Customizations include a barrel ceiling, hand-carved cabinets, a wooden soaking tub and more!

8.title: Seth's Tiny Bachelor Bus
8.plot: Charles and Dakota create a tiny house out of a bus with a fold-out desk and yoga studio.

9.title: Tiny Zoo House
9.plot: Two wildlife experts who travel the country educating people about animals want to trade in their car and pup tent for a tricked-out tiny house that caters to all sorts of animal roommates.

10.title: Timber Frame Tiny Home
10.plot: Married schoolteachers take advantage of their work-free summers by building the ultimate tiny vacation home perfect for tailgating at every baseball stadium in the country.

11.title: Pitmaster's 90-Square-Foot Dream Home
11.plot: A grilling enthusiast builds his own mobile tiny home with features that will help him build culinary creations. But at 90 square feet, it will be a challenge to make the house fully functional and big enough for him to live.

12.title: A Tiny House for a Growing Family
12.plot: Newlyweds want a tiny house-on-wheels for them and their dogs for a move to Colorado. Alabama Tiny Homes builder James Brewer plans to give them a 305-square-foot tiny home until he finds out he needs to make room for a surprise.

13.title: Tiny Space, Growing Family
13.plot: A couple wants to downsize to a tiny home to focus on the important aspects of their growing family. Their builders are pushed to their limits, however, when they learn the couple's baby is coming early.

14.title: Tiny Cowboy House
14.plot: Rob and Sandi spend most of their free time on a ranch just outside of Las Vegas. Rob has built one tiny home before, so he's prepared to tackle a new one with handcrafted features, including a rooftop deck and a hitching post.

1.title: Floating Tiny House
1.plot: A Jersey Shore couple looking to make life more affordable sets out to convert an old houseboat into the floating home of their dreams.

2.title: Empty Nesters Eco Tiny
2.plot: An empty nester devises a special tiny home with eco-friendly features to satisfy her wanderlust. With a full galley kitchen and a laundry room built into the staircase, the final product surpasses her expectations.

3.title: Pushing the Tiny House Limits
3.plot: A surfing couple uses their construction experience to build an affordable tiny house with dog-friendly stairs and heated floors in Oceanside, CA.

4.title: Family of Five's Tiny Skoolie
4.plot: A young couple makes a home for their three children in a tiny school bus. With only 235 square feet, they include an area for home schooling, a relaxing gathering space, sleeping accommodations, a kitchen and a bathroom.

5.title: Nautical Tiny House
5.plot: A young couple takes inspiration from a 17th-century ship while creating the tiny house of their dreams. Their nautical vision includes shingles resembling waves, an aquarium and cabinets that look like whiskey barrels.

6.title: Tiny Fisherman's House
6.plot: Tired of the rising cost of rent, a fishing guide gives tiny living a try. The outdoorsman wants to make his tiny home the ultimate fisherman's crash pad, and his family will pitch in to give the interior an artistic touch.

7.title: Tiny Alaskan Yurt
7.plot: A couple battles the harsh winter elements while building a customized tiny house yurt near the scenic shores of Stone Step Lake in Alaska.

8.title: Nomad's Tiny Home Base
8.plot: A world traveler is settling down in a tiny house community in Lakeside, AZ. Her quirky style pushes her designer to his creative limits and the unpredictable northern Arizona weather threatens to throw construction off track.

9.title: Tiny Adventure House
9.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

10.title: Sam's Tiny Adventure House
10.plot: A contractor that recently relocated to North Carolina is ready for a new building project. He enlists his daughters' help to create an adventure tiny house complete with a drawbridge, climbing wall and even a zip line!

11.title: Big Family's Tiny Lake Retreat
11.plot: A growing family builds the mobile tiny home of their dreams on their lakeside property in Temple, GA.

12.title: Tiny Swoop Home
12.plot: A nomad hires his best friend's father to build a custom teardrop-style tiny house for his mobile lifestyle.

13.title: Tiny Gypsy Truck
13.plot: A performing couple decides to travel and leave the rat race behind by building a mobile tiny home. To maximize mobility and match their gypsy lifestyle, the house is being constructed on the back of a diesel flatbed truck.

14.title: Sally's Tiny Haiku House
14.plot: A woman who currently lives in a 450-square-foot yurt dares herself to go tinier with a 300-square foot house. Asian art, a Dutch door and a slide-out table for six sets her tiny home apart.

-1.title: Luxury Tiny Houseboat
-1.plot: A young Kentucky couple wants the freedom of a tiny house while exploring the lake where they live. They decide to build a tiny house on a boat, complete with a full-size kitchen and even a fishing hole in the living room.

imdb.title: Tiny House, Big Living
plot: Homeowners wish to build a Tiny House either by downsizing or for a first home. This show presents several people in the USA and their finished homes and we see the process that led to their decisions.::Chris Williams
